bibl.title: Egypt under Mu‘āwiya. Part I: Flavius Papas and Upper Egypt. Avec résumé en anglais.

series.title: Bulletin of the School of Oriental and African Studies

bibl.note: Papyri from Egypt constitute the largest body of contemporary documentary evidence for the reign of Mu‘āwiya. Most notable among them are the 107 texts in the archive of Flavius Papas, a local official of Upper Egypt in the 670s [= P. Apoll. Anô]. - Part II will deal with Middle Egypt, Fusṭāṭ and Alexandria.
